summary.p: A copy of the Irāmanāṭakam by Aruṇācalakkavirāyar. See Zvelebil (1995, p. 68).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (June 2023).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

extent.note: Some folios are smaller, e.g. U3, f105 (365 x 35 mm).

collation.desc: 3 folios = guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. f[1]r marbled. Elements of binding.
184 folios = Irāmanāṭakam. Library Arabic foliation 1-180. 8-page quires numbered 1 t0 23 in black ink on top right of first page of quire.
180 folios = Irāmanāṭakam: Text. No pagination. Library Arabic foliation 1-180. 8-page quires numbered 1 t0 23 on top right of first page of quire.
4 folios = guard leaves. No pagination. No foliation. Blank recto verso, except f[4]r. Elements of original manuscript.
3 folios = guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. f[3]v marbled. Elements of binding.

layoutDesc.layout: Written area delimited by black pencil rectangular frame (U1a, U1b).

decoNote.desc: Title printed in golden letters: "RÂMÂYANANÂTAGAM TAMOUL" (spine).

additions.desc:
Title in Roman transcription printed in golden letters on the spine:
RÂMÂYANANÂTAGAM
TAMOUL
BnF current shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 395 (front cover, verso).
BnF old shelfmark in black pencil: Tamoul N° 395 (f[2]r).
Stamp BIBLIOTH. NATIONALE MSS (inserted sheet of paper).
Small sheet of paper, pasted inserted in the binding between f1 and f2, bearing in black ink the title Râmâyananâtagam Tamoul.. Note for the binder indicating the title to be displayed on the spine.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1780 by Vinson (1866-1867) and to 1780 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

listBibl.bibl: Irāmanāṭakam. Tamil Virtual Academy. Irāma Nāṭakak Kīrttaṉaikaḷ. https://www.tamilvu.org/ta/library-l5J51-html-l5J51ind-145276
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 57, no. 395.

Vinson, Julien. 1866-1867. Catalogue tamoul. Handwritten descriptions of BnF manuscripts “Tamoul 4-496” (new shelfmark “Indien 4-496”). BnF Indien 1061 (nos. 4-132), BnF Indien 1062 (nos. 133-204), BnF Indien 577 (nos. 205-496). — See BnF Indien 577, f. 91r, no. 395.
Zvelebil, Kamil V. (1995). Lexicon of Tamil Literature. Leiden [etc.]: Brill.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
